TopicTitle: Making maneuver node around Mun... Release mouse it disappears

Articles.Content: I don't what happened, but I was trying to take readings around the Mun and needed to adjust my orbit, and like always I click the orbit to make a new maneuver node, drag out one of the pones get it set to where I want, release mouse and *poof!* it disappears.  Anyone know what might be going on?
happens once in a while. I've seen it in the prerelease but never found a reliable reproduction scenario. Go back to the space center, select your vessel again, and things should work as expected.

Had the same thing happen to me on a trip to the Mun yesterday.  Maneuver nodes worked as expected until I was in Munar orbit.  I landed without using a node but encountered the same problem after getting back into Munar orbit.

Probably related or caused by this bug:

http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/8212

 

Note that what the steps in that report do explicitly, sometimes already happens in the split second after creating a new maneuver node, especially if the Pe/Ap are being twitchy, because a node with 0 m/s is created that can 'twitch' back and forth a tiny amount negative or positive.

Thanks all for the replies.  It's happening nearly every time I orbit the Mun and try to make a maneuver node.  It is ruining my ability to do anything on or at the Mun.  They need to make this high priority and work on a fix.  If I Understand correctly the only way to fix is to abort the mission?

Its an annoying bug, but Jeb was able to complete the landing and return to Kerbin just by seat of the spacesuit flying (having a custom window with orbital parameters helps).  Jeb is a steely eyed missile man.
Having the exact same problem myself.
Came here looking for a solution because I am encountering the same problem orbiting Minmus. 1.1 with no mods installed.
Haven't played release 1.1 yet, but i had this issue quite often in prerelease. Every 2-3 nodes i was having to revert to the space center.
